conclusion: Containers A, B, and C are positioned at the top of the system, and liquid flows out from these containers.
The liquid encounters baffles (angled barriers) that guide its path downward.
At the bottom, there are two containers labeled D and E, which will collect the liquid.
Liquid from container A flows downward and hits the orange baffle.
The orange baffle directs the liquid toward the left side of the system.
The liquid continues downward and enters container D.
Liquid from container B flows downward and hits the cyan baffle.
The cyan baffle directs the liquid toward the center of the system.
The liquid continues downward and enters container D.
Liquid from container C flows downward and hits the cyan baffle.
The cyan baffle directs the liquid toward the center of the system.
The liquid continues downward and enters container D.
All three liquids (from A, B, and C) are guided by the baffles toward container D.
Container E does not receive any liquid because the baffles do not direct any flow toward it.
The liquid from A, B, and C will flow into container D.
